data.name: Porter
data.description: Dark, rich and roasty. A complex, robust maltiness is supported by a hearty, but balanced noble hop bitterness. Dark brown with ruby hues and a full bodied mouthfeel.

available.name: Year Round

style.name: Robust Porter
style.description: Robust porters are black in color and have a roast malt flavor, often reminiscent of cocoa, but no roast barley flavor. These porters have a sharp bitterness of black malt without a highly burnt/charcoal flavor. Caramel and other malt sweetness should be present and in harmony with other distinguishing porter characters. Robust porters range from medium to full in body and have a malty sweetness. Hop bitterness is medium to high, with hop aroma and flavor ranging from negligible to medium. Diacetyl is acceptable at very low levels. Fruity esters should be evident, balanced with roast malt and hop bitterness.

breweries.name: Black Swan Brewpub
breweries.description:
From the start, Black Swan Brewpub has been driven to provide its customers with a unique culinary experience, delicious beers and warm hospitality.

Our chef, Nick Carter, has taken the dishes we know and love and incorporated freshness, originality and homemade goodness that cannot be found today in Southwest Indianapolis.

Soon, Black Swan Brewpub will have our brewery in place. In the meantime, while construction is underway, we will be serving a spectacular draught selection of craft beers, many of which are made right here in Indiana.

breweries.name: Deepwater Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Deep Water Brewing Co. is our very own three barrel microbrewery.  While the actual brewery is currently off site in Brooklin, it will soon be located behind the Arborvine.

At Deep Water we personally handcraft each and every beer from the best ingredients available. Right now, we serve our beers exclusively at the Arborvine and the Vinery.

Being small allows us to experiment. We brew a number of styles and try to keep them rotating throughout the summer.

Primarily, we brew ales, namely: Pale Ale, Double IPA, Amber Ale, Porter, Oatmeal Stout (coming soon), and British mild.

For special occasions, though, we have been known to break out a keg of lager or two.  In the past we've served: Bohemian Pilsner and Octoberfest (Marzen).  Sometime this summer we will debut our Vienna Lager.

breweries.name: 4204 Main Street Brewing
breweries.description:
At 4204 Main Street Brewing Company we believe simple and amazing food and beer pairing is a staple in life and we wanted to share that. Our neighborhood restaurant and brewery is a place to meet, experience amazing food, carefully brewed local beer and to enjoy life. Whether you love food or you love beer you’ve come to the right place. We are here for the food and beer lovers just like us.
 
We have a unique atmosphere at Main Street and a menu that compliments our beers. From light and sweet to heavy and bitter, you can find a beer here that suits your taste. Come in and enjoy one of these locally crafted beers. Keep coming back to find out about our latest beers and menu items.
 
Our outside patio is dog friendly!

style.name: Robust Porter
style.description: Robust porters are black in color and have a roast malt flavor, often reminiscent of cocoa, but no roast barley flavor. These porters have a sharp bitterness of black malt without a highly burnt/charcoal flavor. Caramel and other malt sweetness should be present and in harmony with other distinguishing porter characters. Robust porters range from medium to full in body and have a malty sweetness. Hop bitterness is medium to high, with hop aroma and flavor ranging from negligible to medium. Diacetyl is acceptable at very low levels. Fruity esters should be evident, balanced with roast malt and hop bitterness.

data.name: Porter
data.description: Rich, roasty, and loaded with chocolate and coffee flavors, this sweet black ale is robust and full bodied. This beer is an excellent pair to any meal, especially meat dishes and desserts. A unique brewing practice allows us to achieve a remarkable flavor profile, by marrying flavors of chocolate, coffee, as well as raisin, caramel, sour fruit, and candy.

breweries.name: Legend Brewing Company
breweries.description: Legend Brewing Company is a commercial microbrewery providing true premium beers to many of the best pubs and restaurants in Richmond and other areas of Virginia since January, 1994. Our mission is to bring to our customers the finest and freshest brews as flavorful alternatives to mass-marketed mainstream products. We're one of the few craft breweries in this region producing both lagers and ales, which require different yeasts and maturation conditions. All Legend beers are unpasteurized and made from only two-row and specialty barley malt, hops, water and yeast.

data.name: Porter
data.description: I'm pretty convinced that if the whole musician thing hadn't worked for Johnny Cash he would have made some pretty good beer.  Specifically he would have made a nice Robust Porter that weighed in about 6%, hopped with First Gold, and it certainly would have been Black.   Well, since as far as I can tell he didn't actually get around to brewing we jumped in and did it.  Our Porter uses a Classic London Yeast strain and plays guitar pretty well.  Next time you're looking for a comfy pint just say "Hey!   Porter!"

breweries.name: Civil Life Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We hold these truths to be self-evident: that all men are created equal, with certain unalienable Rights, that among these are Life, Liberty, and the Pursuit of fine crafted ales. 

We are a local craft brewery situated in the great Tower Grove South neighborhood. We currently have 8 beers on draft a British Bitter, English Best, American Brown, German Wheat, Scottish Ale, Vienna Lager, Black Lager, Munich Dunkel Lager. We built a very traditional pub inside of an old warehouse. Best yet, our beers can be found around town. Head to our web-site at www.thecivillife.com for a listing. Hope you can enjoy a pint sometime soon and check us out. Cheers!

data.name: Porter
data.description: Deliberately delicious, this beer is the perfect companion to a Fall Carolina day.  Four different malts combine with an understated hop character to produce notes of chocolate, coffee, caramel and a light sweetness which permeates the beer. Like its cousin the stout, the porter is full of rich, roasted malt flavors yet has a lighter body and balanced bitterness which gives this style its wide appeal. Moderately carbonated with a clean and bittersweet finish, this beer goes down smoothly and won’t fill you up, so feel free to have a few.

breweries.name: Sugar Creek Brewing Company
breweries.description: Sugar Creek is bringing Belgian-inspired beer to the Carolinas and beyond.  The Sugar Creek Brewing philosophy combines the watchful eye of a Trappist Monk with the technical precision of a nuclear engineer to craft fresh, full-flavored  beers that are immensely satisfying and intensely drinkable. Using unique combinations of aromatic yeast strains, domestic and imported hops and award-winning malt varieties, Sugar Creek infuses traditional recipes with modern tastes and techniques to create beer that nourishes both mind and body.

breweries.name: Backcountry Brewery
breweries.description:
Frisco’s Backcountry Brewery and Restaurant was established in 1996 by a group of Frisco and Summit County residents with a desire to bring great brews and food to their community for the enjoyment of locals and visitors alike.
Backcountry is the second oldest brewpub in summit county. The property (site) Acquired in 1994 by the Mount Royal Brewing Company joined forces with our founding brewmaster and managing partner Anthony Carestia and construction of the Mount Royal Plaza quickly ensued.
The Brewery and Restaurant opened on September16, 1996. Over our 14 year history the Backcountry has established itself as a sanctuary for Summit County visitors and locals longing for great brews, great food and great views. We take great pride in offering diverse ales, lagers and American pub fare. Enjoy!

breweries.description: In todays world to have great taste in beer you have to go to your craft brewers were beer is actually studied and time is taken to insure the quality and taste is always the same. Supporting your local breweries is a great way to keep wonderful, full flavor ale's and lagers available. Ballard, Wa. will soon be the home to Bad Jimmy's with a tap room for everyone to enjoy the full flavor ale's that we have to offer. Watch for us in your local bars and please let us know what you think of our tasty liquid joy.

data.name: Porter
data.description: Porter is brewed to Henry Harvey's recipe of 1859, this beer is an authentic recreation of a Victorian Porter. Pale, crystal and black malts combine with a generous hop grist of Fuggles and Goldings to produce a full, rounded palate with roasted malts to the fore.

breweries.name: Twin Rivers Brewing
breweries.description: Adam's Northwest Bistro & Brewery focuses on taking Northwest ingredients, and turning it into something good and comforting on your plate. We pride ourselves in making our dishes from scratch, from our slow cooked braises and hand formed burgers, to our hot soups and even our Bacon! Not only is our food from scratch but we brew our own hand-crafted beers next door also. Our goal is to provide you with service and atmosphere as if you were eating in our home.

data.name: Porter
data.description: Like Daniel Boone, this AMB flagship is a legend in the High Country. This brown porter is overflowing with dark aromas and has a creamy, persistent, tan head. Delve deeper and you will find a perfect balance between traditional English hops and the complex malt flavors, with a smooth balance between chocolate and coffee. You may not always drink gold, but when you do make sure it’s a Porter.

breweries.name: Appalachian Mountain Brewery
breweries.description:
The Appalachian Mountain Brewery (AMB) is a craft brewery located in the heart of North Carolina’s High Country. Home of the Appalachian State Mountaineers, Boone has countless outdoor activities at your fingertips: rock climbing, hiking, biking, kayaking, skiing, snowboarding, and more! AMB supplies fresh, flavorful beer to the High Country, while maintaining a strong emphasis on both sustainable values and the local community.

Although our craft is beer, AMB is much more than a brewery. Our founding principles go well beyond the pint glass and focus on ideals that strive to empower individuals, support local enterprise, and give back to the greater Appalachian region.  This can best be summarized in our motto:  ”Act Local. Drink Local.”

We will set a new precedent within the brewing industry through an intimate knowledge of the science behind sustainability and a strong desire to improve the current status quo in the field.  We will utilize photovoltaic solar panels, native rain gardens and wetlands, rain water harvesting, and local farm collaboration. Through these efforts AMB will make the highest quality beer while maintaining the highest quality of respect for not only the local community but also the planet at large.

Act Local. Drink Local.

breweries.name: Lumina Brewing Company
breweries.description: Lumina Brewing Company is dedicated to producing beer in small batches. We brew our beer right on premises. All of our beer is fresh with no preservatives. We specialize in brewing German and Bohemian Style Beer. We brew our European Style beer in accordance with the Bavarian Brewing Tradition of “Reinheitsgebot”, the German beer purity law of 1516. This means that nothing is added to the beer except yeast, hops, water and grain. All of our Bavarian Style Beer contains malt and hops from Germany. Our Brew masters have extensively traveled Germany and the Czech Republic and have visited many breweries to learn the art of old world style brewing.

data.name: Porter
data.description: Life is like a sled dog team: if you’re not the lead dog, the scenery never changes. Striving to create a dark beer that has a refined body, our Porter leads with aromas of roasted coffee and dark chocolate. Offering your palate layers of coffee and chocolate flavor and a feathery mouthfeel, Fernson Porter finishes with just the right amount of roasty bitterness. This fermentation from Fernson will lead you in the right direction.

breweries.name: Goose Island Beer Company
breweries.description:
When the first Goose Island Brewpub opened its doors in 1988, domestic, mass-produced beer was deeply ingrained in Midwestern culture. The craft beer industry was still in its infancy, with only a handful of brewpubs in existence in the Midwest. In his travels across Europe, beer-lover John Hall had enjoyed a distinctive local brew in each region he visited. Hall was convinced that Midwesterners could produce beers as good or better than those he’d tasted in his travels. Living on the shore of the largest system of fresh water on the planet Earth, in a city with rapidly evolving tastes – John decided that his hometown, Chicago, would be the ideal place to do just that.

The key to building interest in craft beer, Hall decided, was to allow consumers to watch the brewing process – while providing them with the then-novel experience of enjoying a wide variety of distinctive beers that had been produced on-site. Hall wanted to not only cater to his customers’ tastes, but to challenge them as well. Goose Island’s brewers set to work crafting a diverse selection of unique beers – and on Friday, May 13, 1988 the Goose Island Brewpub was born.

It turned out that John was right; Chicagoans palates evolved rapidly once Goose Island’s Brewpub opened its doors and introduced the city to distinctive craft beer. By 1995, the brewpub had become so popular that John Hall decided to open a larger brewery and bottling plant to keep up with demand. Finding still more room for growth, in 1999 Hall opened a second Goose Island Brewpub just a stone’s throw away from historic Wrigley Field.

Today, Goose Island continues to brew an innovative selection of over 50 craft beers at the brewpub, the best of which are then bottled at our Fulton Street brewery. Goose Island beers are now enjoyed in all 50 states and Europe.

data.name: Porter
data.description: A jet black Robust Porter featuring a blend of 10 malts, our house British ale yeast and the classic UK Fuggles hop.  This recipe provides a very deep flavor that starts with toasty, roasty malt aromas and subtle earthy hops then transitions to malt and bitter chocolate on the finish.

breweries.name: Ore Dock Brewing Company
breweries.description:
As a microbrewery, our focus is on providing a wide variety of beer styles in addition to fostering the local interest in the brewing of craft beer. We consider brewing to be a craft and, whether you are brewing in your garage or on a huge production system, brewing a good beer and sharing it with others is a great way to bring together friends or even an entire community. We are proud to live in a town that is currently supporting two brewpubs and a nanobrewery, and look forward to doing our part to be a leader in the craft brewing revolution.

People in the U.P. work hard, take great pride in what is produced locally and have answered the call in supporting and improving the local economy. The name "Ore Dock Brewing Company" was chosen because we see our local ore docks as grand and iconic reminders of Marquette and the U.P.'s past, present, and future identity. We hope to provide a product and establishment that our community can be proud of for many years to come!

data.name: Porter
data.description:
Our Porter is a dark ale with a mild roasted character and a distinct sweetness from caramel malt.  This medium-bodied porter has a velvety body with Pilgrim hops adding a subtle bitterness and East Kent Goldings hops adding aroma and flavor.  The English yeast helps showcase all of these flavors in this traditional British-style porter.
 
In 18th Century London, the word porter was first used to describe a relatively strong, dark beer, popular amongst the working class.  London brewers became famous for this style, as they began refining the process using better quality malt.  The World Wars led to a higher tax on malt, resulting in lower alcohol strengths in porters. Porter nearly disappeared in the late 20th Century, but was re-introduced in London after small American brewers revitalized interest in the style.﻿

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: Brown Porter
style.description: Brown porters are mid to dark brown (may have red tint) in color. No roast barley or strong burnt/black malt character should be perceived. Low to medium malt sweetness, caramel and chocolate is acceptable along with medium hop bitterness. This is a lightto medium-bodied beer. Fruity esters are acceptable. Hop flavor and aroma may vary from being negligible to medium in character.

breweries.name: The Saint Louis Brewery
breweries.description:
Schlafly is the brand name of beers produced by the Saint Louis Brewery, Inc. Currently, all beers produced by this brewery are under the Schlafly brand. Located in St. Louis, Missouri, it is widely available in Eastern Missouri and Southern Illinois. Schlafly brand beers are distributed to the following states: Missouri, Kansas, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Tennessee, North Western Mississippi, North Virgina, and Washington, DC.

The Saint Louis Brewery, Inc. was incorporated in 1989. It was founded by Dan Kopman and Tom Schlafly,[1] a lawyer and nephew of political activist Phyllis Schlafly, although she is not involved with the brewery in any way. Their goal was to create quality local microbrew beer.

Tasting room hours 10am to late every night (at least 10pm and usually later).

data.name: Porter
data.description: Lightly hopped using Phoenix hops from the UK. Rich chocolate and coffee flavors which are wrapped in a mouth filling smokiness provided by the german rauch malt. Dark as night, with a smooth aftertaste.

data.name: Porter
data.description: Named for those who worked to carry/ deliver goods, this 1862 ale is a combination of the strong ale flavors with the drinkability of a small ale. A historical mix of light and dark malts provide a medium body with roasted coffee and chocolate flavors highlighted with a slight hop bitterness.

data.name: PORTER
data.description: An English style robust porter layered with chocolate, coffee and toasted biscuit flavors.

style.name: Robust Porter
style.description: Robust porters are black in color and have a roast malt flavor, often reminiscent of cocoa, but no roast barley flavor. These porters have a sharp bitterness of black malt without a highly burnt/charcoal flavor. Caramel and other malt sweetness should be present and in harmony with other distinguishing porter characters. Robust porters range from medium to full in body and have a malty sweetness. Hop bitterness is medium to high, with hop aroma and flavor ranging from negligible to medium. Diacetyl is acceptable at very low levels. Fruity esters should be evident, balanced with roast malt and hop bitterness.

breweries.name: Drafting Table Brewing Company
breweries.description: Drafting Table Brewing Company (DTBC) is located in the Village Center Area of Wixom, Michigan.  Through a culmination of 4 years of professional brewing and 8 years of homebrewing experience DTBC seeks to provide artisan craft beer to lovers of ales and lagers around Metro-Detroit.  By uniting selective combinations of ingredients with meticulous brewing practices we keep a high standard for the beer we produce.  In addition to ales and lagers, we serve Detroit native Faygo soda and small snacks.  We encourage guests to bring in food from our surrounding restaurants or even from their own kitchen since we do not have a kitchen. We look forward to providing you with a product we are proud to make in an atmosphere that makes you want to come back.

breweries.name: Mustang Sally Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Mustang Sally Brewing Company (MSB) is a new brewery located conveniently in Fairfax County, Virginia (near the intersection of Routes 28 and 50 in Chantilly).

We are a classic American craft brewery inspired by Old World brewing tradition. We operate in a more than 14,000 square foot space; within that space, we have an expansive 4,000 square foot tasting room that includes a court yard, a private event area, and a traditional tasting room area. We offer a small but thoughtful menu of small plates and panini sandwiches that pair with our beer offerings. We are also BYOF (bring your own food).

Our Head Brewer, Kenny Allen, was previously the Head Brewer of Old Dominion Brewing Company and Old Ox Brewing Company. Our General Manager, Dave Hennessey, was previously the Head Brewer of Old Dominion Brewing Company and a senior manager at Hop & Wine Beverage. Kenny and Dave each hold a Diploma from the Siebel Institute.

We hope to see you for a beer!

breweries.name: Eddyline Brewery
breweries.description:
Eddyline Brewery has been brewing in the heart of Collegiate Peaks in Buena Vista, Colorado since 2009.

All beer are brewed with inspiration from our wild surroundings. Crank Yanker IPA is the best beer for cruising single track all over the valley. River Runners Pale Ale is the greatest all day suds sipper on the river and beyond. Come visit and have a great time in the Colorado Wilderness!

breweries.name: Spellbound Brewing
breweries.description: Our mission is to brew the finest ales in the Northeast. We want to make sure that our beers are approachable to people just starting in the craft beer world, yet with enough complexity for the beer geek. Our goal is to brew several year round beers with a diverse lineup of seasonal and one time beers.

data.name: Porter
data.description: An American porter balancing the full bodied malty characters with lots of chocolates and a light roast note. Keeping the finish strong and flavorful this beer ends with brown sugar and a touch of coffee.

hops.name: Chinook
hops.description: Released in 1985, Chinook is a strong bittering hop derived from Petham Golding, one of the English Golding hops. It is used in stouts and porters for its heavy spicy aroma.

hops.name: Nugget
hops.description: A strong bittering hop derived from Brewer's Gold, with contributions from Early Green, East Kent Golding, and others. Primarily used for bittering, it has a smooth but somewhat heavy, herbal, spicy bitterness. Some feel that its distinctive flavor and aroma characteristics give it potential as an aroma hop as well.

breweries.name: Square One Brewery & Distillery
breweries.description: The Square One Brewery & Distillery began operations as a brewery /restaurant in February of 2006. In August of 2008 Square One became the first microdistillery restaurant in the state of Missouri and one of the first in the country. We believe that our approach to the alcohol beverage program is unique and very different from that of other restaurants. We believe in crafting the products we serve whether it is spirits, beer or food. By combining the expertise of our distiller, our master brewer, and our chef we are committed to creating an amazing array of flavors and tastes for our customers.
